Summary: Looks like bright planet just below another lesser bright planet, SE sky.
divs: Sighting DetailsI have further to investigate, but I see a bright "star" in the southeastern sky that looks like a planet. I view the evening skies every night and am accustomed to seeing at least one "planetary star", but this one directly below the one I usually see. It hasn't moved. Just thought it was peculiar that it appeared suddenly tonight. Apparently, I am not the only one to notice. Others have called into MUFON reporting it, as I called as well. While the "usual star" gets obscured by the clouds, the other one below it seems to brighten intensely as the other one dims. Hmmm...
trends: There have been 9 other sightings in Lapeer
There was one other sighting in Lapeer on or around November 29th 2008
